candidates.title: fix: allow multiline files to be piped to wrangler secret
🐈 1.8.2
candidates.body: This is the release PR for Wrangler v1.8.2.

candidates.title: Prototype: Wrangler Tail
candidates.body:
This PR serves as the feature branch for wrangler tailing.

So far, it does the most fundamental tasks:
- start up a simple server for receiving POSTed logs and printing them out to stdout
- start a cloudflared process (assumes you already have cloudflared installed on your host) to Workers runtime can post to it
- make the appropriate tailing API calls and regularly send heartbeats (once per 60s) to keep tailing alive.

This PR will still need some fixes before I'm satisfied:
- whenever we issue a SIGINT to stop `wrangler tail`, do: (a) graceful shutdown of cloudflared (b) make a `DELETE tail` API call to toggle logging tunnel state to "off"
- Some miscellaneous code maintenance todos
- https://github.com/cloudflare/cloudflare-rs/pull/112 needs to be merged and a new cloudflare-rs release cut.

candidates.title: unifies attention grabbing messages

milestone.description: A small  point release to fix  a bug in our sites impl

candidates.body:
This PR replaces the `message::big_info` function with `message::boxx` which uses a [Boxx](https://docs.rs/boxx) with a project-wide style. All message boxes using this function will be configured the same way, with a rounded, cyan border and a 1 character margin.

```
$ wrangler preview
💁  JavaScript project found. Skipping unnecessary build!

                       ╭─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
                       │                                                                                                                 │

                       │      https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/tooling/wrangler/configuration/#using-environment-variables      │
                       │                               for info on configuring with environment variables.                               │
```

candidates.title: 🙊 1.8.0
candidates.body: @ashleygwilliams tagged me in here to get a PR up with some CHANGELOG additions. I've grabbed about 30 PRs total after sorting by PRs merged after 1.7.0's release date. As best I can, I've tried to organize them into the right section, but someone else should feel free to take over – and pick an emoji! btw my rec is 🙊

candidates.title: 1.8.0-rc.2
candidates.body:
Mini changelog:

Implemented #913 
Fixed #1088 in API
Minor readme fixes for `wrangler dev`

candidates.title: 1.8.0-rc.1
candidates.body:
semi-changelog

things that changed since last release:

wrangler dev now has colors enabled
the `text` field is now the `vars` field
environment vars no longer inherit from the top-level config
if webpack outputs a source map it will automatically be renamed to match the names the workers runtime gives them

if we merge
`wrangler whoami` now lists the account ids and zone ids with the current authenticated user


**still need to run tests locally**

it comes with a fancy auto-resizing box

```console
$ wrangler dev
      ┌────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
      │                                                                │
      │             wrangler dev is currently unstable and             │
      │            there are likely to be breaking changes!            │

      │                                                                │

      │                                                                │
      │                                                                │

```

```console
$ wrangler dev
      ┌───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
      │                                                                                                                                   │
      │                          wrangler dev is currently unstable and there are likely to be breaking changes!                          │
      │                                                                                                                                   │
      │                        For this reason, we cannot yet recommend using wrangler dev for integration testing                        │
      │                        Please submit any feedback here: https://github.com/cloudflare/wrangler/issues/1047                        │
      │                                                                                                                                   │
      └───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

and on terminals that are too small, it falls back to regular prints

```console
$ wrangler dev
⚠️  wrangler dev is currently unstable and there are likely to be breaking changes!
⚠️  For this reason, we cannot yet recommend using wrangler dev for integration testing

💁  Please submit any feedback here: https://github.com/cloudflare/wrangler/issues/1047
```

candidates.body:
had to update cloudflare-rs and it sort of...spiraled. but now we're on the latest reqwest so that's cool. it looks like a big change but it's mostly in the Cargo.lock.

this is critical for work on Config Variables, as all the relevant endpoints will be added to cloudflare-rs post-reqwest bump.

milestone.title: Multi Route Support
milestone.description: Allow users to deploy workers to multple routes.

candidates.body:
fixes a lot of things, but most notably:
fixes #769 

All the functionality of multiroute support with none of the tests. tests in subsequent pr.

example output:

```sh
wrangler publish
💁  JavaScript project found. Skipping unnecessary build!
✨  Deployed to the following routes:
multi-route.bigfluffycloudflare.com/* => created
multi-route-foo.bigfluffycloudflare.com/* => created
```

candidates.title: Feature: Multi-route support

labels.name: regression
labels.description: Something is broken, but works in previous releases

milestone.title: 1.8.0-rc.0
milestone.description: an RC for testing Wrangler Dev, Multi-Route support

candidates.body:
Addresses phase one of #866 

This PR seeks to unblock users who require Wrangler to publish to multiple routes on a Cloudflare zone. It supports:

* Specifying a list of route patterns in wrangler.toml for publish
* a command to list the routes active on a given zone
* a command to delete a route on a given zone

It does *not* support:

* declaring "null worker" routes
* "syncing" routing tables for a project

## Testing this branch

see https://gist.github.com/ashleymichal/b1a3f0d881fed2544b17c3e7ee1ecc17 for testing instructions.

candidates.title: [rc] [dev] Dev Server Feature Branch

milestone.title: 1.8.0-rc.0
milestone.description: an RC for testing Wrangler Dev, Multi-Route support

candidates.body:
Fixes #845

# Wrangler Dev Server -- _Feature Branch_

**[Testing Instructions](https://gist.github.com/EverlastingBugstopper/6e964c8919afdb97397c74fcb1097ccf)** - these should be included in the rc when it gets cut

---

## Testing

Your local `rustc -V` must be at least 1.39.0. You can update by running `rustup update stable`.

You can install this branch by running `cargo install --git https://github.com/cloudflare/wrangler --branch avery/a-time-sync --debug --force`

_(eventually that will get merged and you can install from this branch)_

Go to a worker directory and run `wrangler dev` and curl/postman away!

```console
$ wrangler dev --help
wrangler-dev 
👂  Start a local server for developing your worker

USAGE:
    wrangler dev [OPTIONS]

FLAGS:
        --help    Prints help information

OPTIONS:
    -h, --host <host>    domain to test behind your worker. defaults to example.com
    -i, --ip <ip>        ip to listsen on. defaults to localhost
    -p, --port <port>    port to listen on. defaults to 8787
```
